result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshan Jaquan Peterson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshan Jaquan Peterson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Deshan Jaquan Peterson.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T Franken for Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant has another case in BRANCH 11; 22CF3664. Defense waiting for discovery; body cam. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; if global resolution, all cases can be transferred to either Branch 11 or Branch 16. Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
This case was set in Branch 16 20 10/17 at 1:30 by prelim court. This date does not work for the court so this case is being adjourned to 10/21 at 1:30. Parties notified.

Defendant Deshan Jaquan Peterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Deshan Jaquan Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 15CF271. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Whittenberger. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshan Jaquan Peterson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Deshan Jaquan Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a date for a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshan Peterson not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Co defendant Deandre Dewayne Hill
See attached Map for Geographic Restrictions
North; Meinecke Ave,
South; Lloyd Street, 
West; 17th Street, 
East; 12th Street
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision level 3.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Deshan Jaquan Peterson in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Deshan Jaquan Peterson in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deshan Jaquan Peterson appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
